raw: * Generic selection manager to bring rich desktop like selection behavior
* to widgets and low-level interactive controls.
* The selection handling supports both Shift and Ctrl/Meta modifies like
* known from native applications.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Generic selection manager to bring rich desktop like selection behavior to widgets and low-level interactive controls. The selection handling supports both Shift and Ctrl/Meta modifies like known from native applications.

raw: * Fires after the selection was modified. Contains the selection under the data property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the selection was modified. Contains the selection under the data property.

raw: * Selects the selection mode to use.
* * single: One or no element is selected
* * multi: Multi items could be selected. Also allows empty selections.
* * additive: Easy Web-2.0 selection mode. Allows multiple selections without modifier keys.
* * one: If possible always exactly one item is selected

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Selects the selection mode to use.

  • single: One or no element is selected
  • multi: Multi items could be selected. Also allows empty selections.
  • additive: Easy Web-2.0 selection mode. Allows multiple selections without modifier keys.
  • one: If possible always exactly one item is selected

raw: * Enable drag selection (multi selection of items through
* dragging the pointer in pressed states).
* Only possible for the modes multi and additive

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enable drag selection (multi selection of items through dragging the pointer in pressed states). Only possible for the modes multi and additive

raw: * Enable quick selection mode, where no tap is needed to change the selection.
* Only possible for the modes single and one.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enable quick selection mode, where no tap is needed to change the selection. Only possible for the modes single and one.

raw: * Whether the selection can be changed by user interaction

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection can be changed by user interaction

raw: was triggered by pointer or keyboard [BUG #3344]
* Returns the selection context. One of tap,
* quick, drag or key or
* null.
* @return {String} One of tap, quick,
* drag or key or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the selection context. One of tap, quick, drag or key or null.

raw: * Selects all items of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects all items of the managed object.

raw: * Selects the given item. Replaces current selection
* completely with the new item.
* Use {@link #addItem} instead if you want to add new
* items to an existing selection.
* @param item {Object} Any valid item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the given item. Replaces current selection completely with the new item. Use {@link #addItem} instead if you want to add new items to an existing selection.

raw: * Adds the given item to the existing selection.
* Use {@link #selectItem} instead if you want to replace
* the current selection.
* @param item {Object} Any valid item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the given item to the existing selection. Use {@link #selectItem} instead if you want to replace the current selection.

raw: * Removes the given item from the selection.
* Use {@link #clearSelection} when you want to clear
* the whole selection at once.
* @param item {Object} Any valid item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the given item from the selection. Use {@link #clearSelection} when you want to clear the whole selection at once.

raw: * Selects an item range between two given items.
* @param begin {Object} Item to start with
* @param end {Object} Item to end at

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects an item range between two given items.

raw: * Clears the whole selection at once. Also
* resets the lead and anchor items and their
* styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears the whole selection at once. Also resets the lead and anchor items and their styles.

raw: * Replaces current selection with given array of items.
* Please note that in single selection scenarios it is more
* efficient to directly use {@link #selectItem}.
* @param items {Array} Items to select

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with given array of items. Please note that in single selection scenarios it is more efficient to directly use {@link #selectItem}.

raw: * Get the selected item. This method does only work in single
* selection mode.
* @return {Object} The selected item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the selected item. This method does only work in single selection mode.

raw: * Returns an array of currently selected items.
* Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can
* differ from the sequence in which the items were added.
* @return {Object[]} List of items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items. Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

raw: * Returns the selection sorted by the index in the
* container of the selection (the assigned widget)
* @return {Object[]} Sorted list of items

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the selection sorted by the index in the container of the selection (the assigned widget)

raw: * Detects whether the given item is currently selected.
* @param item {var} Any valid selectable item
* @return {Boolean} Whether the item is selected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

raw: * Whether the selection is empty
* @return {Boolean} Whether the selection is empty

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty

raw: * Invert the selection. Select the non selected and deselect the selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invert the selection. Select the non selected and deselect the selected.

raw: * Sets the lead item. Generally the item which was last modified
* by the user (tapped on etc.)
* @param value {Object} Any valid item or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the lead item. Generally the item which was last modified by the user (tapped on etc.)

raw: * Returns the current lead item. Generally the item which was last modified
* by the user (tapped on etc.)
* @return {Object} The lead item or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current lead item. Generally the item which was last modified by the user (tapped on etc.)

raw: * Sets the anchor item. This is the item which is the starting
* point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was
* tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.
* @param value {Object} Any valid item or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the anchor item. This is the item which is the starting point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.

raw: * Returns the current anchor item. This is the item which is the starting
* point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was
* tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.
* @return {Object} The anchor item or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current anchor item. This is the item which is the starting point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.

raw: * Whether the given item is selectable.
* @param item {var} Any item
* @return {Boolean} true when the item is selectable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the given item is selectable.

raw: * Finds the selectable instance from a pointer event
* @param event {qx.event.type.Pointer} The pointer event
* @return {Object|null} The resulting selectable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds the selectable instance from a pointer event

raw: * Returns an unique hashcode for the given item.
* @param item {var} Any item
* @return {String} A valid hashcode

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an unique hashcode for the given item.

raw: * Updates the style (appearance) of the given item.
* @param item {var} Item to modify
* @param type {String} Any of selected, anchor or lead
* @param enabled {Boolean} Whether the given style should be added or removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the style (appearance) of the given item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: enabled {Boolean} Whether the given style should be added or removed.
@param.description: Whether the given style should be added or removed.

raw: * Enables capturing of the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enables capturing of the container.

raw: * Releases capturing of the container

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Releases capturing of the container

raw: * Returns the location of the container
* @return {Map} Map with the keys top, right,

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the location of the container

raw: * Returns the dimension of the container (available scrolling space).
* @return {Map} Map with the keys width and height.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the dimension of the container (available scrolling space).

raw: * Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.
* @param item {var} Any item
* @return {Map} A map with the keys left and right.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys left and right.
@return.description: A map with the keys left and right.

raw: * Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.
* @param item {var} Any item
* @return {Map} A map with the keys top and bottom.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys top and bottom.
@return.description: A map with the keys top and bottom.

raw: * Returns the scroll position of the container.
* @return {Map} Map with the keys left and top.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the scroll position of the container.

raw: * Scrolls by the given offset

* @param yoff {Integer} Vertical offset to scroll by

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls by the given offset

@param.name: @param
@param.body: xoff {Integer} Horizontal offset to scroll by

@param.name: @param
@param.body: yoff {Integer} Vertical offset to scroll by

raw: * Returns all selectable items of the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all selectable items of the container.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select

raw: * Returns all selectable items between the two given items.
* The items could be given in any order.
* @param item1 {var} First item
* @param item2 {var} Second item
* @return {Array} List of items

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all selectable items between the two given items. The items could be given in any order.

raw: * Returns the first selectable item.

raw: * Returns the first visible and selectable item.

raw: * Returns a selectable item which is related to the given
* item through the value of relation.

* right, under or left
* @return {var} The related item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a selectable item which is related to the given item through the value of relation.

raw: * Returns the item which should be selected on pageUp/pageDown.

* up or down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the item which should be selected on pageUp/pageDown. May also scroll to the needed position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: up {Boolean?false} Which page key was pressed: up or down.
@param.description: Which page key was pressed: up or down.
